image.altText: Liberal Troy Bell celebrates on election night

props.synopsis: Before a juror even set foot in the courtroom, the fraud trial of South Australian MP Troy Bell was one of the state's longest-running criminal prosecutions without a verdict. This is why it took so long.

title.children: Why it took almost a decade to prosecute a state MP

image.altText: Two women watching a woman sign Auslan in a pub with other people

props.synopsis: The founders say their events give people an opportunity to chat, practise and learn Auslan in a social setting.

title.children: Social group gives deaf people and those who want to learn Auslan safe space to connect

image.altText: David Williamson, a man in his 80s, sits in a row of theatre seats, one hand on his chin, the other on his knee.

props.synopsis: Four years after he retired from playwriting, David Williamson brings three new plays to Australia's main stages in 2024, including his latest The Puzzle at State Theatre Company South Australia.

title.children: After 50 years and more than 50 plays, David Williamson is back to skewer non-monogamy

image.altText: A woman smiles in front of the Sydney Harbor Bridge.

props.synopsis: South Australian murder victim Victoria Stewart was a guide, bright light and loving safe place for her five children before her horrific death almost 12 months ago, the Supreme Court has heard.

title.children: Murder victim's loved ones confront killer in SA court

image.altText: A hand holds a mobile phone with the screen showing several social media apps

props.synopsis: As governments — and social media giants — announce measures aimed to safeguard children from social media, teenagers continue to access popular apps such as TikTok, Instagram, Snapchat and Youtube. So what can caregivers do to help children navigate social media safely?

title.children: As governments consider social media bans for children, what can parents do in the meantime?

image.altText: The Brisbane Lions celebrate with the AFL premiership trophy.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions win their first AFL premiership in 21 years with a 60-point victory over the Sydney Swans in the grand final at the MCG.

title.children: Brisbane Lions end AFL premiership drought with thumping grand final win over Sydney Swans

image.altText: Composite image of Brisbane Lions Joe Daniher, Cam  Rayner and Eric Hipwood during play in the 2024 AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: The Ashcroft name returns to the premiership podium with Will's Norm Smith win, Eric Hipwood channels Jason Akermanis and loyal servant Dayne Zorko finally gets his moment. Here are the quick hits from the 2024 AFL grand final.

title.children: Grand final quick hits: Ashcroft makes history, Cam makes it Rayn and Hipwood mimics a legend

image.altText: Nathan Cleary hugs Penrith panthers teammates during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Penrith beats Cronulla 26-6 to reach their fifth NRL grand final in as many years, setting up a rematch against 2020 opponents the Melbourne Storm.

title.children: Nathan Cleary shrugs off late injury scare as Panthers reach fifth straight NRL grand final

image.altText: A large portrait of a man with a beard and turban in a public street.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah confirmed the death of Hassan Nasrallah in a statement about four hours after the IDF said it had killed Nasrallah in an air strike on Beirut on Friday. Follow live.

title.children: Celebrations, disbelief as Middle East reacts to death of Hezbollah leader in Israeli air strike

image.altText: Ruby (right) and George (right) sitting with their cat cartier in their living room .

props.synopsis: Australians in Lebanon face flight cancellations amid growing hostilities between Hezbollah and Israel. Others who can't leave family behind are choosing to stay.

title.children: Australians in Lebanon face flight cancellations, leaving loved ones behind amid escalating tensions

image.altText: A man speaks at a podium with his finger raised to make a point

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu uses an address to the United Nations General Assembly to send a warning to Iran and its allies, as calls for a ceasefire in his country's wars against Hezbollah and Hamas grow louder.

title.children: Netanyahu tells UN there is 'no place' in the Middle East that Israel's 'long arm cannot reach'

image.altText: Maggie Smith, wearing a purple shirt, on a blurred background.

props.synopsis: Smith won an Oscar for The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie in 1970, and later won new fans as Professor McGonagall in the Harry Potter series and the Dowager Countess of Grantham in Downton Abbey.

title.children: 'Thank you Maggie': Daniel Radcliffe leads tributes to Harry Potter co-star Dame Maggie Smith

image.altText: A woman in glasses with cropped grey hair

props.synopsis: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong has used her address to the United Nations General Assembly to call for the international community to come together amid more conflict on Earth than any time since World War II.

title.children: Foreign Minister Penny Wong warns UN General Assembly that world is 'enshrouded in darkness'

image.altText: About 600 campervans and motorhomes in a showground from the air with a rainbow

props.synopsis: RV owners are trying their best to quell a reputation as a stingy group of travellers during a large gathering in South Australia this week with efforts to spend locally, donate items, and learn about Indigenous culture.

title.children: Campervan and motorhome owners highlight their economic muscle as hundreds gather for rally

image.altText: Piggy bank and overdue bills

props.synopsis: Financial counsellors have weighed in on the cost-of-living crisis currently gripping the country, giving some of their best tips to saving money and avoiding getting price gouged.

title.children: Barefoot Investor among financial counsellors offering tips to tackle SA's high cost of living

image.altText: A composite image of Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Labor's inability to come clean about who ordered the Treasury to work on negative gearing left the government and prime minister Anthony Albanese smeared as tricky, dissembling and guilty of treating voters with contempt.

title.children: 48 hours of confusion has backfired on Labor, when they could have just come clean

image.altText: A close-up of an elderly woman standing in the doorway of her caravan, wearing a striped shirt.

props.synopsis: Dozens of grey nomads bought houses in a caravan park on the promise it "couldn't be sold from underneath them". Then it was.

title.children: 'This must be a joke': Caravan park put up for sale without home owners' knowledge

image.altText: Two men speaking

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy presents his "victory plan" to Donald Trump during a closed-door meeting, after the US presidential candidate vowed to work with both Ukraine and Russia to end their conflict.

title.children: Zelenskyy says 'very productive' talks had with Trump at New York meeting

image.altText: Half of a white metal hull with debris around it lies on the ocean floor, with blue water and harsh light

props.synopsis: A US Coast Guard hearing into the 2023 Titan submersible disaster has ended but not before some dramatic revelations. Here are the key takeaways.

title.children: From talk of buying off congressmen, to previous malfunctions — all the key takeaways from the Titan sub hearings

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment Group's shares bombed on Friday, losing close to half their already heavily discounted value, after the company narrowly avoided collapse, securing a last-minute $200 million bailout from its bankers.

title.children: How the end of money laundering sank Australia's casinos

image.altText: Captains Lachie Neale and Dane Rampe hold the AFL premiership cup during the grand final parade

props.synopsis: Sydney Swans stand-in captain Dane Rampe says he is hoping his unhappy grand final memories will help in his side's decider against the Brisbane Lions.

title.children: Rampe hoping that fourth time is the charm on grand final day

image.altText: Singer Slim Dusty leans on a car near Uluru

props.synopsis: Australia's "King of Country Music" performed for a number of remote Queensland towns over his 60-year career, and the communities have never forgotten it.

title.children: Why Slim Dusty's friendship with Indigenous Australia is worth singing about

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a shady tree

props.synopsis: A consumer group has advised Australians to "shop around" for cheaper groceries, but for people in regional areas, choice is a luxury they don't have.

title.children: 'We don't have a choice': Regional Australians paying the price of supermarket duopoly

image.altText: An entrance to an airport reading "Welcome to Rome".

props.synopsis: It was a Wednesday morning in Rome when Italian police received an Interpol red notice from Victorian police. Within two days, Perry Kouroumblis would be under arrest for the killings of two Australian women almost five decades ago.

title.children: When Italian Police received a red alert on a wanted man all the way from Melbourne, they got to work fast

image.altText: An infrared image of the Sydney Opera House.

props.synopsis: UNSW researchers have made a breakthrough for renewable energy production, demonstrating for the first time the ability to produce electricity from radiant infrared heat sources. The emerging technology could be powering our home appliances while we sleep within five years.

title.children: Night-time energy could power our appliances via an emerging technology developed by Sydney researchers

image.altText: A moving satellite image of a hurricane moving over the coast of Florida.

props.synopsis: The storm prompted hurricane and flash flood warnings extending far beyond the coast up into northern Georgia and western North Carolina.

title.children: Hurricane Helene cuts destructive path through south-eastern US with at least 33 dead

image.altText: Police thumbnail

props.synopsis: Thousands of vacancies for police officers across Australia are making it harder for forces to protect the public, unions say.

title.children: Police are leaving the force 'in droves' with thousands of unfilled positions intensifying workloads

image.altText: A man in high-vis chainsaws a tree that has fallen on a wet country road.

props.synopsis: Thousands have been left without power, rivers are rising and SES crews are scrambling to answer more than 180 calls for help as heavy rain and gale force winds batter communities.

title.children: Weather bureau issues warning as intense low lashes northern NSW

image.altText: Tourist under umbrellas with Sydney Opera House in the background

props.synopsis: While September has been the driest month this year, Australia is on track for a fifth straight year of above-average rain, with forecasts predicting a wet end for 2024.

title.children: Australia set to record fifth consecutive wet year as NSW coast faces flood threat

image.altText: A man takes a selfie on a chairlift with snowy mountains in the background

props.synopsis: The Wodonga man is the third patient to die after bilateral knee replacement surgery performed by the same doctor at a private hospital, an inquest hears.

title.children: Kenneth's family thought his knee replacement was a routine surgery. Then he died in hospital

image.altText: A Chinese woman offers a prayer in front of  flowers.

props.synopsis: The deadly stabbing of a 10-year-old boy in China has raised alarm among the Japanese community in the country while triggering a flood of criticism of the incident and extreme nationalist comments on Chinese social media.

title.children: Why has the fatal stabbing of a schoolboy divided the Chinese internet?

image.altText: An elderly Indigenous woman sits beside the red road with a rake and bucket.

props.synopsis: Food insecurity leads to disastrous health outcomes for the most the isolated. Some believe a focus on native ingredients could help turn things around.

title.children: Many Australians struggle with chronic diseases. Daisy believes native 'superfood' could improve their health
